website_summaries.verdict: Big 12-inch pliers with strong grip quality. Long handles give the user plenty of leverage.
pros: Strong grip of these jaws with adjustable width makes for a versatile set of pliers
Easy to adjust jaw size while working
Plastic coated handles ensures your hands won't slip
Ratcheting motion makes these pliers easy to use
cons: Cost more than other sets of pliers
Large set may not work for all jobs

customer_reviews.title: Burn In Hell Crescent Wrench!
customer_reviews.text: Tell your trusty thumb-detecting-nut-rounder to visit your grandpa in hell, and drop a chunk of your rent on these in a 10" and a 7". You'll be the envy of your job site. Your ex girlfriend from high school will call you and tell you she messed up. Your mother might finally quit her drinking. Well, probably not, but she'll be mighty impressed with how quickly you fixed that plumbing under her sink. Anyway, this is a beautiful and excessively useful wrench that has launched me into a lifelong relationship with Knipex. If I ever lost this tool, I'd replace it quicker than my tears would dry. It's that perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Francise

customer_reviews.title: 5-inch model REALLY tiny.. But very powerful !
customer_reviews.text: I got the 5-inch model. I was shocked by how small they are when I opened the package. At first I was thinking "These look like little toy pliers... Maybe I'll give them to my 3 yr old son" But, Immediately after using them for the first time, I have realized that this is NOT a toy! These tiny pliers are incredibly well built, and the leverage makes it possible to grab things really tightly. I was able to easily smash the edge of a nickel. (See my included picture.) I can't wait to add the 10" set to my collection. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: jfrazier

customer_reviews.title: A league of it's own!
customer_reviews.text: The 12 inch pliers wrench is in a league of it's own! I am a plumber by trade, and hobbyist mechanic. I find the 10/1 leverage ratio to be extremely helpful, specifically when making connections on CSST gas lines which require an immense amount or torque. There's nothing quite like exerting as much torque as you're capable of knowing the jaws won't slip or mar the surface. Well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Fogle

customer_reviews.title: So far this seems like a winner
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality tool, I bought this 5 inch version to carry in my pants pocket. It is fairly light, and is not bulky in my pocket. I have tried it on various fasteners and it works very good. At first I ordered the 6 inch version, but it was too heavy to EDC in my pocket. It is amazing how much difference 1 inch makes. This 6 inch weighs 6 oz, while the 5 inch is about 3 oz, and the head is much slimmer. If you plan to carry this everyday, you should opt for the 5 inch model, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Repairguru

customer_reviews.title: Hyd Line Checks
customer_reviews.text: A&P Mechanic's best friend, above the ball peen hammer and flathead. Performed a full hydraulic line torque check on in 737's MLG wheel well (everything was removed and reinstalled), quickly found 2 unions and 3 hyd lines loose/seeping with just this 10" Knipex, sizes ranging from 9/16" thru 1-3/4". Shortly after, operational flight control checks had no leaks with 3000 PSI. Everyone is trying to borrow this amazing tool. The only issue - Skydrol (commercial aviation hyd fluid) soften the rubber grips on the 1st day. I can see this peeling off in a few months even after cleaning, but the pliers will still serve its purpose. Might get the 7" Knipex just for my truck next.
customer_reviews.author: T. Q. Le

customer_reviews.title: ... on a whim because I thought they would be useful to me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on a whim because I thought they would be useful to me. I used them on a couple trips and found them to work well but did not really work for what I was doing. If they auto adjusted I think I would have liked them better but having to push in the adjuster button and move the jaws one spot was sometimes tricky so I took them out of my travel box and put them in my home tool box. This tool is built amazingly well though and it works well which is why I am still giving it 4 stars. It just didnt work well for what I planned on using it for.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Poland

customer_reviews.title: It looks a toy but it isn't
customer_reviews.text: I think the first reaction for most people handling this tool is to think it is a toy for children - it really looks a toy! You will change your mind after a few uses. It is a very useful tool for applications where alternative ones can mean more time and nuisance. It is a joy to use and they are very functional for smaller bolts. There is an engraved scale to help you to initial setup of the tool. Updated on January 25th, 2019: today I discovered it can be a great tool for climping electrical cables. The parallel movement of the jaws combined with its toothless make difference to present high quality results.
customer_reviews.author: Osvaldo Cristo

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy
customer_reviews.text: I first purchased a 7-inch version of this, the 5-inch seemed very small. But the 7-inch impressed me so much I decided to give this a try. This is probably my favorite tool now, I am not really handy, but I was working on a project involving a Raspberry PI and I broke part of the case I was using by accident, I could not get anything in place with the right leverage to take off the standoffs, this worked perfectly for that. And I keep finding good uses for it. The only thing is that my son thinks it's a toy :D It is very well made, just like pretty much every other Knipex tool I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool, I use this all the time at ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool, I use this all the time at work. Its probably the most versatile tool I've ever used. It can be used to loosen/tighten anything with a set of parallel flats, tasks like bending sheet metal, or for gripping parts when grinding/sanding. You get so much leverage from the action, you can use it for crushing things as well. Highly recommended as a tool for a traveling kit for the trunk of your car. Give your old adjustable wrench to your nephew or sell it at a garage sale because it's now obsolete...
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Epic Little He man
customer_reviews.text: Very strong for a small pliers. Knipex great for gripping there was a doubt for this little guy to grip any bolts, however I was using this on computers bolt fit perfect or any tight area that no pliers could not do. Second great thing about this small pliers unlike regular size pliers from Knipex line this little one can also straight out sheet metal or bending computer corner of the door or anything that need to flatten this will get the job done. Well done again Knipex never let me down always make my life easier on the job, at home, or any DYI project worth the price. Thank You.
customer_reviews.author: DT8891

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Made in Germany
customer_reviews.text: Knipex in my opinion is one of the top tier brands in the industry. I own a dozen or so of their products for comparison so their was no question when I made this purchase. The tool looks & operates flawlessly. I have no doubt this will be passed down for several generations with proper care. I own the similar size with serrated jaws but wanted the smooth jaws to prevent scarring expensive nickel plated fasteners. I now own both but should have bought the dual pack with belt carry case from the start.
customer_reviews.author: Handi-man

customer_reviews.title: Aviation mechanic...uses them daily.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these things. You can use them to press bearings, take off large axle nuts, grab stripped bolts, the list goes on. I even squished stainless rod to make a flat spot for a screw. I am an aircraft mechanic and we all have knipex. Those that don't, want them and borrow them all the time. I've used them to set rivets in some hard to reach areas my rivet squeezers won't fit. They work good (not great because jaws wiggle some) for installing nut plates. Knipex are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Well made tool
customer_reviews.text: I like knipex tools and generally use them everyday, I have not found this tool to be as useful as I thought it would be. In most cases for my use an actual wrench is much easier to use. This tools works perfectly in the right circumstances but is cumbersome to adjust and most of the time for me just not easy to keep on the fasteners.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: This is better than sliced bread
customer_reviews.text: You know that when you pass along to the next life, that these are the tools that they are going to be FIGHTING over. Expensive, sure but when it gets you through that one JOB, or saves you going back to the tool box for the 1,000th time -- its CHEAP. The clamping force is so precise and leveraged, that it is practically impossible to tear up your fasteners. And it works in tight spots that conventional tools just can't get to. Like a when there is no clearance on the side, with this you can grab it from the top. Get the small & medium size ones, you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Zeck

customer_reviews.title: Replaces Your Cresent Adjustable Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, geek's good in the hands. 10" model is the perfect size for just about every job. I won't throw away my Cresent Adjustable Wrench but I probably won't use much any more. The knipex pliers wrench makes short work of 99% of the tasks I use it for. I highly recommend this to professionals in every field and even the handy homeowners.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Provine

customer_reviews.title: 3 star due to corrosion and packaging
customer_reviews.text: Pliers work as they should but were stored/packaged poorly. There is some rust on them and what appears to be some kind of epoxy or other hard substance on one side of the jaws. I had to use a razor blade to scrape it off as a plastic scraper and my fingernail couldn't remove it. Definitely dropped prior to me receiving them at least once. The jaws themselves are clean but all in all feels like I bought a pair of used knipex at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: frickin cute yet entirely and effective tool
customer_reviews.text: This is my third knipex pliers wrench. I swear by them. They are the answer to so many open-ended mechanical problems. It's the best general multi tool out there. you have to hold the 5" version in your hands to really get a perspective of how small it is. It's rediculously cute, especially next to my 7" and 12" versions. It seems to have the same tolerances as its bigger brothers, only scaled down. It feels sturdy and I doubt it will wear or crumple, no different than my other ones.
customer_reviews.author: nicholas f.

customer_reviews.title: How did I not know about these???  An amazing tool.
customer_reviews.text: Really amazing tool. High quality, precision build, no serrations on the jaws, so non-marring. The jaws are thin and fit where a standard open-end wrench or Crescent wrench won't fit. Adjusts to what seem like specific metric sizes, although I haven't actually measured that. Great design - the more turning effort you apply, the tighter the grip on the bolt head. Although they are expensive, it is money well spent. I plan to buy this tool in other sizes. A great addition to a Dirt or Street Motorcyclist's tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES HOYLE

customer_reviews.title: Knipex does it again
customer_reviews.text: So I've had these for 3 months now, they have far exceeded my expectations. I have them in my Veto back pack and carry it with me every time I get out of my van. They are like an adjustable wrench, only better and easier to use. The 10" open really big, and close all the way, like flat to get a wrinkle out of sheet metal. Super strong grip, crazy strong, they don't slip. Loose the adjustable wrench and put these in your bag instead. you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ElevatorDave

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I've used hand size even tension (or parallel) pliers for decades, but because they only open half an inch or so, the moment I saw these I knew I had to try them and they are FANTASTIC! Extremely well made and worth every penny, these adjustable ultra wide opening parallel smooth jawed even tension pliers are useful in so many applications when regular pliers would result in marring or deforming the work.
customer_reviews.author: Robt. Neville

customer_reviews.title: You need these
customer_reviews.text: Why in the hell do they still sell channel locks in big box stores. I feel sorry for people who still don’t use these. Trust me you will never go back to channel lock once you get these. These things are better than a rigid pipe wrench when it comes to gripping onto a pipe or worn out bolt. Once these wrap their teeth into something it’s coming off. Iv even put box end of a wrench on the handles of these for extra leverage to break bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grayson powers

customer_reviews.title: great product for small hands
customer_reviews.text: this wrench is self adjusting, doesn't pinch fingers, and provides plenty of leverage. the plastic handles are thick enough and the finish is superb. the machined joint doesn't wobble, and it fits in a pants pocket. however, it is too small for big hands, so buy it if you need a very portable wrench, have small hands, or are giving it as a gift to a small-handed recipient.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to set solid rivets in the sheet metal ailerons of my airplane. It worked great. That's not the reason I'm writing this review. Today I had to change the wax ring of a toilet. I grabbed the KNIPEX and an adjustable wrench. Didn't need the adjustable wrench. Removing the water supply then the bolts holding down the toilet was effortless. This is now my new favorite all around tool. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: SoftwareEngineer

customer_reviews.title: Knipex is the best
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE Knipex tools and the PliersWrench is one of the most innovative tools I’ve ever seen. This is my fourth size. You’ll wonder how you ever got by without it. You can keep your Chinese junk. Knipex quality is the best
customer_reviews.author: Old Man Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Unique Pliers
customer_reviews.text: These pliers are like nothing else on the market as far as I am aware. They are of excellent quality and quality control. They're a little pricey, but one can spend that much taking the family to a fast food restaurant these days (whereas if you buy a pair of these pliers, they'll likely last past your lifetime). They replace a number of wrenches with just one tool!
customer_reviews.author: JEEPNATION

customer_reviews.title: So many uses great size
customer_reviews.text: Throw away your wrenchs and get this and the 10" one. Very versitel wrench. Amazing torque and the way they engineered to give you crazy leverage. If you want the best quality pliers knipex makes them. Easy adjustment. Small size for hard to reach areas. This and the 10" is pretty much all you need. Kliens are also great quality but don't make these
customer_reviews.author: Nweezy

customer_reviews.title: Small But Mighty!
customer_reviews.text: I love these little things ! I thought they would be a little silly and useless but of course I had to have them. But when I got them I started using them all the time, there great because they can fit into real tight areas and best of all the fit perfectly in the side pocket of carhartt pants. I use these things all the time and they have no wear at all. Awesome little tool.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: extremely versatile, gotta have it
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 6" after using my coworkers 7 1/4", before it became an amazon prime product (so i paid for shipping) because it was just a "gotta have it" tool and I figured it'd be perfect for my "oh $hlt" bag which is taken with me on every job. We sometimes work in really tight spaces where you have more flexibility with this than a conventional adjustable wrench. Also handy when you can't see the fastener/nut you're working on. Finally gave in and bought the 7 1/4 to fit the 1 1/16" and 1 1/8" sizes for myself in addition to buying the 6 for a few friends
customer_reviews.author: chichi

customer_reviews.title: One of best wrenches out there
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT pliers. This is a smooth jaw adjustable wrench for hex-head bolts and nuts. Brilliantly designed to actuate slightly so that the tool doesn't just fit perfectly, but actually grips and holds the hardware for absolute ZERO play. The jaws are on a slide rather than a hinge so that they stay parallel to each other no mater how close or how far apart you adjust them to. Construction quality is top grade.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great wrench with lots of versatility for its size.
customer_reviews.text: I have these pliers in several different sizes and love the versatility of all of them. These shorter pliers come in handy when you need a wrench to tighten a B-nut but don't want to carry the whole tray of wrenches to figure out what size you need. Strong enough to pinch a penny because of the mechanical leverage built into the design too. I carried a wide jaw craftsmen crescent wrench that I shaved the handle off of as a quick tool to get into places but these pliers weigh about the same, take up about the same amount of space, and by design don't leave any slop between the tool and the hardware to allow rounding out.
customer_reviews.author: HeloFxr84

customer_reviews.title: ton of gripping torque
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a few wrenches in my motorcycle tool bag and it did not disappoint the grip force from this tool is unreal from mechanical way it works the jaws do not move much because of that aso you do have to pick the correct size to use for the nut/bolt but you will not strip anything with these better than vise grips
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pliers as they should be!
customer_reviews.text: German tooling at its best. One of the several tools I wish I found sooner. Spend your tool money wisely and get quality over quantity. Now I will purge the other pliers that I thought were "good". Precision machining makes them a joy to work with. Crazy comfortable in my hand. And they won't nip you when you squeeze the handles together. Great job, Knipex! I'm a customer for life!
customer_reviews.author: nannobooboo

customer_reviews.title: The neatest tool that you didn't know you needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tool. I like how I can really apply pressure to a bolt, nut or whatever without marring it. Given its small size it opens up quite a bit. I find myself using it instead of crescent wrenches that tend to round things even when snugged up as tight as possible.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burns

customer_reviews.title: What a great tool. Tricky to get used to though
customer_reviews.text: What a great tool. Tricky to get used to though. They don't act or move the same as channel locks or the cobra pliers, it's like no tool I've used before so once I got over the learning curve I love them. I work in the communications industry and every day I need to install and remove nuts and bolts of various sizes both sae and metric and the time that the pliers wrench saves me by not having to constantly search for wrenches by far out weighs the cost hands down one of the best tool purchases I've made
customer_reviews.author: D. Markwell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pliers, good bye channel locks, hello Kinpex. I love these, I’m a building maintenance plumber, so size and weight matter. Anyone who works service plumbing knows how difficult it can be to squeeze into small spaces, or how impossible it can be to fit your tool into get at a fitting. These are hands down the best out there. Definitely recommend. I have all different sizes, mostly 10” and above because commercial calls for larger size tools. But I’m getting the smaller for my home kit. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CCM

customer_reviews.title: Insane Grip!
customer_reviews.text: Great wrench! Really grips on to fittings even without squeezing the handles. Also good for squeesing leather rivets together or small press fit parts. Using it at work for piping up to 1" npt applying a lot or torque and haven't broke it. Opens to about 1 5/8" or 41mm. Its .328" or 8.3mm thick.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Not a replacement for a crescent wrench or a pliers
customer_reviews.text: It’s useful if the nut isn’t very tight but it doesn’t lock like a crescent wrench does. It IS much faster than a crescent wrench and to the point it doesn’t adjust itself as you use it the way crescent wrenches usually do. BUT it is no better than a gas pliers if the nut is tight and the price is exorbitant.
customer_reviews.author: P. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Missing from my life
customer_reviews.text: Was working on some stupid seized power steering lines, regular wrenches and my flare wrenches were too long. Buddy lent me his knipex plier wrenches and omg where have these little beauties been in my life?!?! Bought them as soon as my hands were clean enough to poke at my phone. Bought the little cobra's too while I was at it, for the rounded nuts that inevitably show up!
customer_reviews.author: Waylan Wong

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended to me and I was skeptical but, Shortly after I got it I had occasion to need it and it works great. Does exactly what it is supposed to do and beats a crescent wrench hands down. Not sure what else to say. It was a great addition to a small tool pouch that I keep in my saddle bags.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Bishop

customer_reviews.title: It is better than a comparably sized adjustable wrench and so much ...
customer_reviews.text: I just used this the other day at the drill press. Not many people want to spend this much for a hand tool but once you do you will see why it is worth it. It is better than a comparably sized adjustable wrench and so much more. You can use them for part clamping, rivet tightening, ratcheting/wrenching, plumbing, mechanical work, etc. I also own the 6" size for daily carry at work The engineering is German. Great care is taken in the forging, machining, and chrome plating. I will use these tools for a broad array of work over the years, and pass them on to the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: SaveThais

customer_reviews.title: Interesting tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using crescent wrenches and channelock pliers for 45 years. These are an interesting melding of the two. The push button is to adjust the size and you only have to get it close. Pushing down on the back handle, the tool works the same as a channelock, the hard you push, the tighter it gets. I haven't used it a whole lot yet, and it feels like I need to develop some muscle memory when adjusting it, but it seems to work well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mannon

customer_reviews.title: These work better than anything else on the market
customer_reviews.text: Oh, these pliers are the best!!!! I have 3 pairs of them, this is the handiest size. The adjustment mechanism could not be easier to use, and the casting of the head is precise and expertly crafted. I have not seen a product on the market that combines the functionality and quality of these pliers....and I pretty much use them every day. One thing about them that is truly wonderful is that the faces are smooth, and by the design of the pliers, that is a good thing, it does not mangle delicate fasteners.
customer_reviews.author: S. Garsson

customer_reviews.title: Jaws all messed up
customer_reviews.text: The jaws are garbage I brought used from amazon and the condition was listed as very good. Apparently the amazon quality inspector doesn't know how to use pliers. I called and amazon gave me another $5 off the price and after filing and polishing the jaws smooth they are usable for what I want. I don't know what the guy before me was doing to them to mar the jaws so bad, but if they don't stay good with normal use, I'll be back to update and mark down another star.
customer_reviews.author: Sassquatch

customer_reviews.title: VERY WELL MADE
customer_reviews.text: A friend who's a metal worker/sculptor uses these and fixed two aluminium brackets on my Airstream while we were at an RV park. MUCH tighter than an adjustable wrench. Very well made; he's had his for years and years and although he takes extremely good care of his tools, they still look great and perform well. I ordered mine right away and I'm amazed at how well they work compared to adjustable wrenches. I'll probably buy different sizes now.
customer_reviews.author: BeemerPilot

customer_reviews.title: Replaces 15 Wrenches
customer_reviews.text: Simple tool that truly works. I was in need of getting wrenches size 22mm - 32mm and decided to try this wrench before shelling out $600+ for wrenches. All I can say is I've never rounded a nut and break bolts loose with this that other mechanics can't. I use this mostly for heavy suspension work and alignments. The only thing it doesn't do is get into recessed areas like a deep socket will. I love this pliers wrench and use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I have the blue and yellow brand in the 8" and 10" versions of the same tool. I needed the 12" for a project and went with the Knipex ones. I have several other styles of their pliers but the price of these made me wait until I actually needed them. In comparing these side by side with the other brand I mentioned is a great example of "you get what you pay for" The quality, fit and finish of the Knipex is miles ahead. I'll be upgrading my 8" and 10" to Knipex.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nicholls

customer_reviews.title: Neat pocket gizmo
customer_reviews.text: I daily carry this. It's many uses become apparent sporadically. I mainly use it to troll a couple of my coworkers who think it's a flimsy little toy. I bring it out whenever it's even a fringe case that it may come in handy around them.... but every so often it's to do things like tighten bolts on a mini-excavator leaking hydraulic fluid at an accelerated rate, or to straighten the only sawzall blade we brought to the trench. This thing is incredibly versatile for something that weighs nearly nothing, and takes up very little space
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Saurus

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Pliers
customer_reviews.text: Where have these little Pliers been my whole life. I bought them to use on my 3d printers when I am needing to change nozzles and they work great for that, but they also work great for other projects where you need a small set of pliers. I plan on buying the bigger versions soon and have the complete set.
customer_reviews.author: GuruOfTech

customer_reviews.title: Interesting tool that turns heads on the job. Well ...
customer_reviews.text: Interesting tool that turns heads on the job. Well made and has a lot of leverage. Not sure it's worth the price though... Edit: this tool is the s**t. Don't expect it to replace channelocks because it won't. It will replace your adjustable wrench. It NEVER slips. It's faster too once you get the hang of it. It will bend, pinch, crush, crimp too. This thing grips hard and dosent damage smooth surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Hebert

customer_reviews.title: Buy em now the quality is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey but worth every red cent. Buy them now and you will thank your past self later. The flat jaws dont mar. Even on brass! If you know anything about tools you know knipex is where its at. And while your at it grab some of the cobra locking slip joints! And no I'm not a knipex salesman haha.
customer_reviews.author: Jake lacy

customer_reviews.title: excellent built
customer_reviews.text: love the pliers. they do everything i want and more. i can find no flaws in them. i wished i had got a bigger set of these. so i guess ill order that asap. they replace a lot of other tools in the box if you want to update and make room. these are 5 star quality
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers period...
customer_reviews.text: Knipex makes the best pliers period. If you’re looking for a set and they make it, buy them. The quality and functionality is outstanding. I’m a 30 plus years contractor and these are the single highest quality hand tools I know.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Etges

customer_reviews.title: Now a cult member
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I think you're overpaying if you get the Knipex raptors unless you really need something that can survive an insane amount of torque. The home depot husky version of those which auto adjusts is more convenient to use. These, however, are worth the money. It's way more than a crescent wrench. I reach for it every time I want to apply some torque without damaging what is being held.
customer_reviews.author: Kelliar

customer_reviews.title: A must have. A smart purchase. This will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. This will last a lifetime. Buy this instead of large individual wrenches. Opens larger and thinner face than a large adjustable wrench. You can tighten/loosen faster with this, than a wrench or adjustable wrench. You get what you pay for and if you purchace this you'll be happy you did.
customer_reviews.author: BUCKEYE

customer_reviews.title: Single best tool in my bag
customer_reviews.text: Much has been said about this tool that I don't need to repeat, but this one tool pretty much replaced every crescent wrench, box wrench and socket that I own. I almost never need those tools anymore, because this does it all! The best part is the way you can so easily release pressure and just turn to the next facet on a nut, sort of like a ratchet but with way more flexibility. Just be warned, once you start buying Knipex tools, it's hard to stop!
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Handy

customer_reviews.title: Clearly a used / opened item
customer_reviews.text: So, $45 for a small pair of pliers is ridiculously expensive, but these are quite nice for a gift. I expected a perfect item that would present well as a gift, but instead pliers were in a box that was clearly cut open and sealed with scotch tape. Box was also crushed since shipped in a bag to add the the impressive presentation. I don't know what is going on with Amazon vendors, but I get a lot of previously opened/returned items. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Favorite tool in the bag
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have if you’re in the industrial electric industry. Perfect for unions seal tight connectors and just an all around game changer to keep in the tech bag. Smooth jaws make sure no connector is gnawed. Older guys may tell you to different but....ok boomer
customer_reviews.author: Cj breen

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find tool Now EASY
customer_reviews.text: Parallel action pliers are a specialty item. smooth jaw that ope more than 1/2 an inch have been hard find until this variant that looks more like a channel lock came along. Now I can grab a finished metal part bigger than a roll pin and still not worry about marring. What's not to love? Oh BTW, The precision of this thing is just a good as jewelers pliers,, but far easier to apply grip force.
customer_reviews.author: OV

customer_reviews.title: When you need this tool, nothing else will do.  Good for an armours' toolkit.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for driving the roll pin for the bolt release in an AR upper. No marring. The gripping surface is flat, no gripping ridges. It is this flatness that makes it a great tool for delicate work that requires evenly applied force. I have also used it with great success in building Amateur radio antennas; no marring, just an evenly applied force. The 10 inch is a good size, easy to use, not too big or too small.
customer_reviews.author: Pinky

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the greatest tools ever invented. If you came here looking for this tool you already need it. It's a little pricey for such a little tool HOWEVER it fits in your pocket and will be something you use every day! GAME CHANGER!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Bit but was very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Was not what I expected, packing reminds me of bulk production in 3rd world areas. Tool appears fair, but wont meet my needs. Have email to return
customer_reviews.author: richard cannon

customer_reviews.title: Great every day carry tool.,
customer_reviews.text: Knipex has a deserved reputation for useful quality. These every day carry pliers are suitable for tight gripping and burr free removal or install of parts. Gives better gripping power than my selection of useful good brand multi pocket tools. You do get what you pay for in this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Gun

customer_reviews.title: Small accurate pliers
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a set of wrench pliers to use for light duty assembly tasks. The 7 inch pliers work perfectly if you have sufficient room grab the fasteners. This set of pliers will not totally replace the need for a dedicated wrench or nut driver in some cases, for me these work 80 to 90% of the time for the task at hand. Nice well made addition to my travel tool kit.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E ThomasTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Item is fine, but clearly is not new as the listing said
customer_reviews.text: The wrench itself is great, these things last forever and take a beating, but I can tell that it is clearly not new. The box it came in was also completely beat up and roughed up with age and it was taped closed with some scotch tape. I'm only giving it 4 stars because it is used when it said it was new. But otherwise, it is still great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add to my tool roll for my motorcycle. I used it on a week long ride when my windscreen bolts worked themselves loose. It's small, but easy to use in tight spaces. I was impressed enough to order the 10" version when I got home. Very good product and worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: J. Page

customer_reviews.title: This is a perfectly designed tool
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical given the price compared to other adjustable wrench options, but this thing is great for difficult to turn nuts/bolt heads that you want to avoid rounding over. This certainly beats channel locks or a conventional crescent wrench. It may seem expensive but it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: The 7 inch pliers wrench and the 7-1/4 inch Cobra Pliers have been my most used tools as an Instrument Tech. I received them 3 months ago, and they still work like the day I received them. Only problem I've had is the button to adjust the opening size on the Cobra Pliers fell off. Tool still works. It just takes more pressure to activate the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Mike W.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't pay any attention to the one star reviews! They need training in how to use Knipex pliers wrench!
customer_reviews.author: Conservative America

customer_reviews.title: must need
customer_reviews.text: These knipex pliers are amazing. The jaws stay parallel. Great for bolt heads or pressing in bushings
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Benner

customer_reviews.title: Knipex are excellent German crafted hand tools
customer_reviews.text: I love Knipex hand tools. Plier wrenches are great, I have bought 4 sizes and this size is probably the most versatile. I know Knipex has changed this model and the 10 inch sizes so they may be slimmer in some areas so verify what model you are buying. These tools have many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Someoneyoumayknow

customer_reviews.title: Quality, practical tool for pocket carry
customer_reviews.text: I have had the larger version of this for a while, and use it quite frequently, so decided to order this, smaller, unit. When I unboxed it I was a bit disappointed by the small size, however with every day use I reach for it more and more often. It handles screws up to about 20 mm which is really the most commonly used range and it is wonderfully efficient to carry in a pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding grip without scarring bolts or tubing
customer_reviews.text: I have worked In industrial maintenance for about 15 yrs. I love the knipex water pump pliers and have been using them daily for maybe 10 yrs. I have only had the 150mm (6") pliers wrench for almost a year, but they stay in my back pocket now. It's my "go to" tool as it grips very strongly, but doesnt mar brass tubing fittings. They are expensive, but worth a lot more than they cost!! If you are reading this, buy them...you won't regret it
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: If Vice Grips and a Crescent wrench had a baby
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tool - it is like combining the gripping power of Vice Grips, with the precision and non-stripping/teething on bolts/nuts aspect of a Crescent Wrench. My father says he has used his pair to remove lug nuts before as well (by stepping on the pliers) - although not the best use, it's still impressive the quality of the tool. Not sure if he has the 10-inch pair or the 12 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use for light gunsmithing (trigger guard pins, gas block pins, etc.) and they work perfect for me. The quality is very very good. I wish the price was a bit lower so I could buy more in the line!
customer_reviews.author: JNFoo

customer_reviews.title: Clever Design
customer_reviews.text: I'm just a home owner not a mechanic., but this is certainly a very clever, very functional design. I wish I had known about Knipex years ago. I would never have bought a crescent wrench and probably wouldn't have bought a set of fixed wrenches either.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bencze

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. I've always hated adjustable wrenches and have avoided them like the plague. Not any more. Grips tight, easy to adjust easy to use and nicely made. If you appreciate good functional design buy it and you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Wagon Willie

customer_reviews.title: Not expensive for a lifetime of use
customer_reviews.text: Love these. So much more accurate and grip than crescent head or channel lock pliers. I use the 7” in case of emergency roadside repairs on my motorcycle. It fits in my Kriega tool roll very well. Not cheap, but you’ll get a lifetime of use, and it’ll still be able to be handed down to the next generation.
customer_reviews.author: Bill the bookie

customer_reviews.title: These are AWESOME, I use them for EDC (more like 2-3 ...
customer_reviews.text: These are AWESOME, I use them for EDC (more like 2-3 times a week because I rotate all my gear as im a gear junkie) and they really come in handy. Fit and finish is nice, they are precise and offer a wide range of adjustment and ease of use. Great for almost anything a normal set of pliars are, as well as a crescent wrench!
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: They do "look" like slip joint pliers like Channel locks
customer_reviews.text: Knipex has a well deserved reputation for quality and a price to match. "Pliers" is a bit of a misnomer in the description of this tool. They do "look" like slip joint pliers like Channel locks, but they actually function more as a precision adjustable (Crescent) wrench. Now that some of the beloved Crescent wrenches are made way offshore, the Knipex is the way to go. I have this pair in onboard motorcycle tool kit. Spendy yes... but you only cry once when you buy a quality tool. You'll cry many times with a cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: Val Richard

customer_reviews.title: Insanely useful yet gentle.
customer_reviews.text: They are bizarre.. They effortlessly grip like crazy yet don't mark, yet at the same time seem to be made of some kind of god like material that doesn't dent. I'm buying the 7" ones too.. For those wondering how to find the size you need. Just put the plier in place with the handles closed, slide to meet the piece. Open handles and click 1-2 notches smaller to give you some leverage room.
customer_reviews.author: Breaddrink

customer_reviews.title: Great for AR builders to install those pesky roll pins
customer_reviews.text: These are great for AR builders. Easily install the trigger guard, bolt catch, and gas block roll pins by using these as a press. The jaws are smooth and compress parallel to each other. You have to stop to readjust the pliers but it beats the heck out of hammering away at awkward angles on those annoying roll pins. Just put a layer of electrical or other padded tape on the jaws for further protection of the finish on your lower. Awesome product and I wish I had purchased these for my first build!
customer_reviews.author: st381

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and handy pliers.
customer_reviews.text: These are the handiest pliers along with the Knipex Cobra pliers. These work perfectly on small nuts and the Cobra for everything else. Perfect workmanship and sturdy even though they are small. Easy to carry with you for when you need them.
customer_reviews.author: Jakpro

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality, most useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I have every available size of pliers wrench. They have seen some heavy use over the years and still perform as new. Just a great tool that anybody who does any work turning hex head screws should have. Also great for bending. Hall of fame level tool.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher England

customer_reviews.title: Love not trying to figure out what wrench size
customer_reviews.text: Fit, finish, build, comfort, function I like everything about the tool especially the size. I got the 6 inch one and it fits great in my pocket for at work. At first the tool seems expensive, but at home: so far this takes the place of a lot of standard and metric sized wrenches. The number of wrenches, even cheep ones, that this replaces, for me, at home is more money than the tool cost. I have a 10 inch version, I love using at home.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Hance

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: These things grip tightly! I was grinding a small part and was trying to hold it with conventional vise grips. I just couldn't get the vise grip to hold my part tightly enough to keep it from moving. Then I remembered I bought these pliers. They did the job with ease!
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Engineering
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Smooth jaw, narrow, locking, great leverage, no bruising of brass fittings and no broken blood vessels in my hand trying to hold the channel lock shut. The adjustment button can false trigger in really tight quarters but the other benefits have me ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Diddledee

customer_reviews.title: Best Adjustable Pliers, Ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. The number one reason I bought them is for the flat parallel jaws. This allows me reduce damage to components that I'm working on and only carry around one tool instead of a whole set. As a side these will fit perfectly inside the small Wera ratchet socket set. Makes for the perfect backpack tool kit for an Engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 007

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive, but it does work like nothing else I have used. Grip of death without marring the work. Shoulda bought one (or more) of these years ago. Jealous of those who have a collection of these. Still, maybe $10 too expensive by my reckoning, but you can save little by buying a set of two.
customer_reviews.author: Carlgo

customer_reviews.title: The Best !
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but worth it if you use tools. I have six other pairs of Knipex pliers of varying configurations and am appreciative of fit, finish, craftsmanship and thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Gary T.

customer_reviews.title: Best adjustable wrench I own!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no need for adjustable wrenches anymore, this is the best wrench I have ever had. The amount of pressure that you can put on the surface of what you are gripping is incredible. If you would normally use an open end or crescent wrench this will take its place. I can't believe how much pressure it gets while clamping down, it will not come off. It will not strip a nut. A contractor friend of mine showed me this so I bought one too. I bought another one to give to my dad for Christmas, he loves it too.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best pliers ever!
customer_reviews.text: Probably my most-used pliers at work. I got them mainly to flatten out the edges of really thin sheet-metal after it's been cut, but they are so versatile I've been pulling them out over my regular pliers, too! Get a purple sizes and you're set for life. Amazing quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Unique wrench
customer_reviews.text: I bought these do to the extremely smooth flat jaws. They work well on finished fasteners. The only drawback is your grip on the pliers determines the amount of applicable torque available before the finish is damaged or the pliers slips. I am very happy with them for my use.
customer_reviews.author: AL-ks

customer_reviews.title: Great design.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding product, really impressed with the holding ability of these pliers. I doubt if I buy any more adjustable wrenches. You will still need some version of "Channel lock" pliers because the smooth jaws on these will not grip pipe. I was surprised at the fit and finish of the pliers since they come from Germany. Mold seems were very evident though smooth. The channel that the movable jaw rides in was not machined correctly on one side. None of this affects operation of the tool.
customer_reviews.author: William K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Toss out your Cresents ......
customer_reviews.text: Toss out your Cresents or any variant that has a thumb wheel ...... expensive?, yes ..... worth it?, yes ...... be prepared to buy more than one size, just like you would with your legacy wrenches ..... this size is a great one to start with ..... it will take care of 75% of your DIY needs and is perfect for the tool belt .......
customer_reviews.author: C. Green

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: I know as a mechanic that there is never one tool for every job but this comes close. While it will never replace a box or open end wrench this thing locks on very well and has little slip. Use it a lot for a lock bolt on a bike rack hitch mount. Works great for when you forget the right size wrench on the trail off roaring too
customer_reviews.author: viewer1

customer_reviews.title: Great for aircraft mechanics
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for aircraft mechanic. Super handy and very well made Smooth jaws don’t damage hardware and also avoids the slippage of the infamous crascent wrench because as sliding pliers you can actually apply pressure to the hardware you are dealing with. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Knipex pliers are excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nephew as a graduation gift after using these for years myself. Can't go wrong with Knipex, all their products are impeccable. I expect to pass mine down after using them for a long time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Willem R. Vandenberge

customer_reviews.title: These are the best of the best!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pliers. They are so good in fact, I bought their big brother in the 250 mm set. I also bought three pairs of the Knipex Cobra pliers: 150 mm, 180 mm, and 250 mm. These are the best of the best! I wish I would have discovered them years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lindley

customer_reviews.title: pricey! The best is not cheap! Although 4 what U receive it is  a REAL bargain!
customer_reviews.text: It exceeded all expectations! What more can I say other then THANK U!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mel Lo 1

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: All I have to say is get one or two of these. I may get a larger one later on. Only thing I wish is that they made the tips a little pointier. Still hard to get into tight places. Other than that great quality and feel. They come in a little box and wrapped in plastic. I tossed all that before this review.
customer_reviews.author: D

product_meta.title: KNIPEX Tools - Pliers Wrench, Chrome (8603300)
product_meta.description:
Size:12-InchMade In Wuppertal-Cronenberg, Germany. In Addition To Quality, Innovation And Performance, Other Important Cornerstones Are Sustainable Actions And Value-Guided Orientation.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Knipex 8603300 12-Inch Pliers Wrench is excellent for gripping, holding, pressing and bending work pieces. The high lever ratio, parallel jaws without profile and infinitely variable adjustment guarantee a secure and smooth gripping of the work piece free from backlash. Zero backlash jaw surface pressure prevents damage to edges of sensitive components. Fast adjustment directly on the work piece by pushing a button. The action of the jaws allows screwed connections to be tightened and released quickly using a ratchet principle. Lever transmission is greater than 10 - 1 for strong gripping power. Can also be used for tile breaking.
feature_bullets: The Number 1 Choice Of Tradesman Worldwide
Comfortable In Use And Quality Assured Design
Fit To Match The Needs In The Shop, At Home Or In The Service Field
Each Tool Is Proven And Tested For Durability And Function In Real World Use And Conditions

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,490 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
